text: hey my name is Jordan Romero and this is
the time I climbed Mount Everest when I
was in the fourth grade I saw a mural
the highest point on every continent I
was fascinated by it and I said dad why
don't we climb the Seven
Summits I could tell he was shocked but
then he said okay then let's get
training first Mountain Mount
kilamanjaro 10 years old second Mountain
Mount Kiosco highest mountain in
Australia third Mountain mount elbris
highest mountain in Europe the fourth
Mountain mount and kaga highest mountain
in South America 11 years old fifth
Mountain Mount McKinley highest mountain
in North America the sixth Mountain we
climbed was Mount Carston's pyramid
highest mountain in Indonesia I climbed
that when I was 13 years old and then
that all led up to the highest mountain
in the world Mount Everest the height of
the mountain 29,35 ft that is pretty
high that's how high planes fly the
mountain took 6 weeks to climb which for
me was very tough because that's the
longest I've ever been away from home
what a lot of people don't don't know is
during those 6 weeks we're not just
climbing straight up it's a lot of going
up and down and getting your body used
to breathing the thin air it's kind of
like climbing a smaller Mountain every
day so Mount Everest is so high you have
to use oxygen the weather didn't go easy
on us at all we endured some pretty cold
temperatures down to -40 today's the day
and this is our last time going up the
morning of May 22nd 2010 the Sun had
risen I saw the beautiful Summit pyramid
I looked at my dad and I said Dad it's
right there at that moment I knew that 4
years of preparing for this climb is
finally going to pay off the things I
remember from reaching the summit was
taking those final few steps and
touching the top of the world a moment
that I had dreamed my whole life yeah I
can't believe it one of the first things
I did when I reached the summit was we
pulled out the SAT phone and called my
mom I I could hear her in tears she was
just so happy and she said come back
down so I can hug you to death I
remember seeing the Earth curve out in
the distance we were surrounded by all
these giant Himalayan Mountains I
couldn't have done this at all without
the support of my dad and my family so
never be afraid to step out of your
comfort zone always believe in yourself
and don't be afraid to go big find your
Everest you just watched a TTI on Disney
Channel
